page.title: 14SWINDERBY, A YEAR ON A FARM.
page.content: On{ Newtons' Farm} work begins in Autumn when the land is {ploughed }and {sprayed}with fertilizers of the basic nutrients of phosphate and potash, by an agricultural contractor. Prills of nitrogen are applied in the spring. Wheat and barley are{drilled}(sown), in Autumn, peas and tic beans in the spring. Crops are sprayed in the Autumn, if necessary, and in the spring with herbicides and pesticides. The crops are {harvested }by combine in August and September. Grain is put into circular Butler and Simplex Bins holding 30-60 tons, where it is dried. It is sold to 2 local grain merchants. In 1985 the{barley straw}has gone to a local pig farm, the{wheat straw}is going in high density half ton rectangular bales to cover carrots. The { hedges }are cut mechanically straight after harvest.
